meanings.definition: To sell goods or services at a lower price than a competitor.
meanings.sent1: The store decided to undersell their rival by offering the same product at a cheaper cost.
meanings.sent2: It is common for businesses to undersell their products to attract more customers.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky salesman tried to undersell the high-quality item by highlighting its minor flaws.
meanings.sent4: She managed to undersell her artwork, making it seem like a bargain compared to others.
meanings.sent5: The company's strategy to undersell their products quickly gained them a larger market share.

meanings.definition: To present (something) in a way that makes it seem less valuable or important than it really is.
meanings.sent1: The article's title seemed to undersell the groundbreaking research it contained.
meanings.sent2: Sometimes, people unintentionally undersell their achievements when talking about them.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to undersell his talent only made others appreciate it more.
meanings.sent4: The cover of the book undersold the thrilling story hidden inside its pages.
meanings.sent5: She didn't realize her words would undersell the true beauty of the sunset she described.
